metadata.title: CVE-2022-45939 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
GNU Emacs through 28.2 allows attackers to execute commands via shellmetacharacters in the name of a source-code file, because lib-src/etags.cuses the system C library function in its implementation of the ctagsprogram. For example, a victim may use the "ctags *" command (suggested inthe ctags documentation) in a situation where the current working directoryhas contents that depend on untrusted input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45939` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

emacs - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-bin-common - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-common - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-el - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-gtk - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-lucid - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-nox - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
emacs-pgtk - 1:28.2+1-12ubuntu1
No subscription required
